alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:21PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Converse County through 700 PM MDT... At 621 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Laprele Reservoir, or 10 miles west of Douglas, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Douglas and Laprele Reservoir. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 130 and 141. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for east central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range
